summary.p: 95 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: E. H. 13; Text: Q 5:1-Q 14:27 (?); 13 lines per page; Dimensions: 118 x 75 mm; Script style: kūfī; Estimated date of production: 2nd (8th) to 3rd (9th) centuries [according to Karatay].

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 5: "12 E. H. 13 Kur’ān’dan bir bölüm Parşömen. 75mm boy ve 118mm eninde cönk biçimde 95 yaprak. Sahifede II-III. asır kûfîsi ile 85mm uzunl.[uğunda] 13 satır. Y. 1b ve 2a, 94b ve 95a da müzehhep levhalar vardır, sure başları aynı üslûpte tezhiplidir. Miklepli mor deri Osmanlı cildi. Bu mushaf Mā’ide (5) suresinin 1. ayeti ile başlar ise de ondan sonraki sureler İbrahim (14) suresinin 27. ayetine kadar eksiktir. Bundan sonrası Kur’anın sonuna kadardır."

This can be translated as follows: "12 E. H. 13 A part of the Qurʾān Parchment. 95 junk shaped leaves of 75 mm height and 118 mm width. The text area written in Kufic script of 2nd-3rd century [contains] 13 lines measuring 85 mm. There are illuminated plates in L. 1b ve 2a, 94b and 95a, the sūra beginnings are decorated in the same style. Purple Ottoman leather binding with flap (miklep). Although the codex begins with Q 5:1 (Sūra al-Māʾida), the following chapters are incomplete until Q 14:27 (Sūra ʾIbrāhīm). Then it continues until the end of Qurʾān."
